title: 820-01958 no power
message:
Arrived with liquid damage around u7650. Before starting repair board was slightly turning on and charging battery.

After replacing U7650 and surrounding components board now only has a 12.30V PPBUS_G3H and power cycles every few seconds. Solders are good on U7650

What should be checked next?

title: 820-01958 no power
message:
Something else affected by liquid, possibly CPU, or other BGA chip.
You should inspect small resistors and traces too.

title: 820-01958 no power
message:
The only section of the board that had liquid was around u7650. Resistors and traces have been inspected thoroughly.  The spill was minor.

PPBUS_G3H 12.33V

PP5V_S5_LDO 0.863V

title: 820-01958 no power
message:
The resistors and traces have been inspected along with continuity testing. The minor spill occured only in the U7650 area.

PPBUS_G3H 12.33V

PP5V_S5_LDO 0.860V

title: 820-01958 no power
message: So, you have steady 12.3V at PPBUS_G3H, or power cycling?

title: 820-01958 no power
message: steady 12.3V at PPBUS_G3H

title: 820-01958 no power
message: Post basic voltages for U7650.

title: 820-01958 no power
message:
P3V3MAIN_PGOOD  3.2V

P5VG3S_PGOOD 0V
